title: Native American Spirituality
description: Learn about the spiritual beliefs and traditions of Native American peoples

questions.question: What is a 'vision quest' in many Native American traditions?
options: A rite of passage involving fasting and solitude to receive spiritual guidance

questions.question: The 'Great Spirit' (Wakan Tanka) is a concept central to which Native American people?
What is a 'totem pole' primarily associated with?
In Navajo belief, what is the purpose of a 'sand painting'?
What is a 'sweat lodge' ceremony used for?
Coyote appears in many Native American myths as what type of figure?
The 'medicine wheel' is a sacred symbol used by many Plains nations to represent what?
options: The interconnectedness of all life and the four directions

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'dreamcatcher' in Ojibwe tradition?
options: It filters dreams, catching bad ones and letting good ones pass through

questions.question: The Hopi 'kachinas' are what?
options: Spirit beings that represent aspects of the natural world

questions.question: In Iroquois (Haudenosaunee) creation myth, the world was created on the back of what animal?
What is a 'shaman' or 'medicine person' in Native American traditions?
options: A spiritual healer and intermediary with the spirit world

questions.question: The 'Sun Dance' is an important ceremony for many which group of Native Americans?
What does the concept of 'walking in beauty' (hozho) mean in Navajo philosophy?
options: Living in harmony and balance with the world

questions.question: The 'Thunderbird' in many Native American traditions is what?
options: A powerful supernatural bird that controls storms

questions.question: Many Native American traditions share a belief in what relationship with the natural world?
options: Deep interconnection and respect for all living things
